triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: Paper demonstrates how biodiversity patterns emerge and fluctuate in microbial communities.

triples.name: Population ecology
triples.relevance: Paper uses population ecology theory to explain species coexistence and abundance patterns.

triples.name: Microbial ecology
triples.relevance: Paper proposes bacterial microcosms as a novel experimental system for testing ecological theory.

triples.name: Coexistence theory
triples.relevance: Paper tests coexistence theory by observing how species coexist under different interaction strengths.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: Paper demonstrates three distinct dynamical phases as species and interaction strengths vary.

triples.name: Community (ecology)
triples.relevance: Paper studies emergent properties of ecological communities through microcosm experiments.

triples.name: Phase transition
triples.relevance: Paper demonstrates phase transitions in microbial ecosystems between stable, partial, and fluctuating states.

triples.name: Emergence
triples.relevance: Paper shows how complex emergent patterns arise from simple community-level features.
